content.question: At <math alttext="10. degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="20. grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of oxygen gas exerts a pressure of <math alttext="2.1 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in a rigid, <math alttext="7.0 Liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> cylinder. Assuming ideal behavior, if the temperature of the gas was raised to <math alttext="40. degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40.</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which statement indicates the new pressure and explains why?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.9 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.9</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases by the proportion <math alttext="283 over 313" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>283</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>313</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="2.3 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increases by the proportion <math alttext="313 over 283" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>313</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>283</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="0.52 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.52</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases by the proportion <math alttext="10 over 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40.</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="8.4 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increases by the proportion <math alttext="40 over 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>40.</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10.</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="2.3 atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increases by the proportion <math alttext="313 over 283" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>313</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>283</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
